total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the pattern in the transformation from the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that the output grid is a 10x10 grid, which is twice the size of the input grid in both dimensions.
Q3: Observe that the first half of the output grid is a copy of the input grid with the center value replaced by the top left value of the input grid.

Q4: Notice that the second half of the output grid is a 5x5 grid with the same value as the top left value of the input grid, followed by a 5x5 grid with the same value as the center value of the input grid.
Q5: Apply these observations to the input grid of the quiz to generate the output grid.
Q1: Identify the pattern in the transformation from the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that the output grid is a 10x10 grid, which is twice the size of the input grid.
Q3: Observe that the first half of the output grid is a mirrored version of the input grid with the center value replaced by the outermost value of the input grid.
Q4: Notice that the second half of the output grid is a mirrored version of the input grid with all values replaced by the center value of the input grid.
Q5: Apply these observations to the quiz input grid to generate the output grid.
Q1: Identify the pattern in the transformation from the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that the output grid is a 10x10 grid, which is twice the size of the input grid in both dimensions.
Q3: Observe that the first half of the output grid is a mirrored version of the input grid with the center value replaced by the top left value of the input grid.
Q4: Notice that the second half of the output grid is a mirrored version of the input grid with the center value replaced by the bottom right value of the input grid.
Q5: Apply the same transformation to the input grid of the quiz to generate the output grid.
